description: From Middle English biclappen (“to grasp, insnare, catch, to trap suddenly, to grab suddenly”), equivalent to be- +‎ clap.

verbs.description: beclap (third-person singular simple present beclaps, present participle beclapping, simple past and past participle beclapped)

entries.meaning: To grasp, insnare, ensnare, catch, to trap suddenly, to grab suddenly.

verbs.description: beclap (third-person singular simple present beclaps, present participle beclapping, simple past and past participle beclapped)

examples: No one is so beclapped as the author of a popular drama bowing over his own footlights; the artists and romancers of the daily press are modester than they themselves would be willing to admit.
